channel.title: Strange connection error
channel.description: Ok, so I set up my server, No-IP DUC, Java and other apps. I can log into my client from mopar as well as silab(the server is #########.no-ip.biz) from my computer. But when my friend tried it (several times) he kept getting an error saying that the server was "offline". He can log onto other servers but he can't log on to mine. What could be the problem here as well as trying to solve it? (btw, it might be my dsl router...)

item.title: Strange connection error
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

Still not working… :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 12, 2008, 05:48:11 pm[/size][hr]Ok, on my RANGEMAX Wireless router I have it set up as: (Service name)RSPS (Port)43594, and the IP address is the default one for my computer. Should I have that IP set as my computer’s default one or set it as my desired server IP?

Read full topic

item.title: Strange connection error
item.dc:creator: @Yeckar Yeckar
item.description:
@Yeckar wrote:

Hmm. I have a netgear router too. The ip was 192.168.2.1, default username was user, pass was blank (not sure if you got that far =P) Anyway, what I think they mean is this.

When you go into the system properties sheet (accessed by the windows key and Pause/break ath teh same time, or by the control panel) you go into advanced, and environment variables. There, you add a Variable by the name of PATH, with something like “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;” as it’s value. I think you also add a CLASSPATH with “CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;” as its value. I don’t know if thats what their talking about, but it’s a guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange connection error
item.dc:creator: @Ps2_Jake Ps2 Jake
item.description:
@Ps2_Jake wrote:

Not sure if I did it correctly, I can’t follow the port forward tutorial as I have a different router. (NETGEAR)
Two other questions, what do you mean by PATHs? and should I port forward to my server IP or my computer’s default IP? (current is computer)

Read full topic

item.title: Strange connection error
item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

Even when you portforward, check your PATHS.

Read full topic

item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Portfrowarding.
make sure you did it ALL right, then re try.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange connection error
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

have you port forwarded? if not do that then check back and see what it does.
